definitions.definition: The process by which an object, person, place or idea may be copied mimicked or reproduced .

examples: That painting is an almost exact replication of a famous Rembrandt painting.

definitions.definition: A response from the plaintiff to the defendant's plea.
The process of producing replicas of DNA or RNA molecules.

The process of frequent electronic data copying a one database in one computer or server to a database in another so that all users share the same level of information. Used to improve fault tolerance of the system.

main_definition: The process by which an object, person, place or idea may be copied mimicked or reproduced .
secondary_definitions: ( law ) A response from the plaintiff to the defendant's plea.
( biology ) The process of producing replicas of DNA or RNA molecules.

( computing ) The process of frequent electronic data copying a one database in one computer or server to a database in another so that all users share the same level of information. Used to improve fault tolerance of the system.
